data.title: Horrible!
data.text: This place was decent when it first opened, but then it lost its drive to please the customer. The food took forever, it was cold, and missing components! The wait staff didn't care, and argued with you. Would never recommend this place, or anything owned by this family! By the way this restaurant is closed now!

data.title: My new favorite Mexican restaurant in town
data.text: This location has changed owners and names several times but once it changed as Las Fincas it has become my favorite place in town to go for Mexican food! I hope it lasts longer than all of the other ones that went out of business

data.title: Good Home Mexican Cooking
data.text: This small but brightly decorated restaurant is a great place to go for authentic Mexican cuisine.  The food is fresh and well seasoned without being too hot to enjoy.  The management and staff are friendly and attentive.  It is clean, bright, and airy.  The outdoor dining area is also a nice place to dine and enjoy the great view of the New River.  My husband and I have eaten there several times and plan to go as often as we can.

data.title: Mexican food
data.text: I had the chicken taco salad. My husband has the steak fajitas. Both were good. But typical Mexican found locally. It does hav a nice view on the water front of New River. Will say it was better then some of the other local Mexican food places.

data.title: Best Mexican food in town!
data.text: Went for dinner on the recommendation of a friend & it was great! The menu is different and the food was freshly made and delicious. I find other local restaurants menus to be similar & the food is sloppy & served so quickly you know it's not being made to order, quite the opposite here & something for everyone on the menu. The service was wonderful and the staff were so friendly & eager to make our experience a good one. I highly recommend this place & it will be my go to for Mexican food from now on!

data.title: Excellent authentic food, clean, excellent customer services.
data.text:
My friend and I from ROLC went there for quick lunch and we felt like were the only customers. The food were served hot, fresh and plentiful to last (me) the next meal. It reminded me of food served in an authentic restaurants in San Diego. Good management, eticquetter, and friendly smiles. It was pronto service with beautiful presentation of food and mucho delisioso. If they can open one on base, mucho vien gusta. Thank you Las Fincas.. p.s. we've been there coming back ever since. Try their "alomost vegan Chile rellenos". Satifsfactory delicious. 
M O'Dell

data.title: Excellent all the way around
data.text: Went here for dinner with my husband had a burrito macho and he had fajitas jalisco my burrito was huge and his fajitas looked awesome lots of meat and shrimp not just the veggies like other places the decor is beutiful and drinks are rediculously cheap tuesdays we go for the $2.99 margaritas love them cant wait to go back we r deff usuals nnow
